Package com.complexible.common.iterations

Contains classes for defining and using Iterations.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Iteration<T,E extends Exception>
    New iterator interface.
    PeekingIteration<T,E extends Exception>
    An iteration which exposes the next element it will return.
    SupportsIteration<T,E extends Exception>
    Interface for marking something that can be iterated over via an Iteration, analogous to Iterable
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractIteration<T,E extends Exception>
    Abstract implementation of the Iteration interface providing an implementation for all the basic methods of the interface.
    ArrayIteration<T,E extends Exception>
    Implementation of an Iteration backed by an array.
    DelegatingIteration<T,E extends Exception>
    Implementation of an Iteration which delegates its methods to a child Iteration.
    Iterations
    Utility class for working with Iterations
    MultiIteration<T,E extends Exception>
    An adapter to provide a single iteration over a list of iterations.
    TransformException<T,IE extends Exception,OE extends Exception>
    Implementation of an Iteration which will apply a function to transform the exceptions of an inner iteration to a different exception type.
    TransformIteration<I,O,E extends Exception>
    Implementation of an Iteration which will apply a function to transform the results of an inner iterator to a different type.

Package com.complexible.common.iterations Description

Contains classes for defining and using Iterations. Iterations are analogous to standard Java Iterators with the exception that they are closeable and can throw an exception when calling Iteration#hasNext or Iteration#next.
